**Brief Background on the CCGS Griffon:**

The CCGS Griffon was constructed in 1969 and entered service in 1970. The vessel primarily operates in Lake Ontario and the Gulf of St. Lawrence during the year. Historically, it provides icebreaking assistance during winter months while assisting with shipping and maintaining seabed markers in the Great Lakes during open navigation season.

**Objective of the VLE Project:**

The main aim of this project is to extend the lifespan of the CCGS Griffon. It includes refurbishing and overhauling significant components of its propulsion and steering systems to ensure optimal performance and efficiency. It will involve upgrading major equipment like motel generators and ship-handling solutions. Key deliverables include major engineering solutions for the vessels' hull coating, propulsion, and electrical systems. Contractors are mandated to handle the removal of outdated components and heavier-duty repairs while maintaining compliance with Canada's native free trade agreement.
